cyclone.name: BERYL
cyclone.current_location: about 780 miles east-southeast of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest toward the Lesser Antilles, forecast to cross the island chain late Sunday night and then track through the eastern Caribbean toward Hispaniola
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Leeward / northern Windward Islands (near Dominica-Martinique)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch – Dominica;  Tropical Storm Watch – Barbados, St. Lucia, Martinique, Guadeloupe, St. Martin, St. Barthelemy
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Lesser Antilles from Barbados northward to the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico, then toward Hispaniola and the central Caribbean Sea
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–46 mph with higher gusts) are possible on St. Croix late Monday into early Tuesday; only a 3 % chance of 50-kt (58 mph) winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected, though rough surf and rip currents are likely.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Monday–Tuesday with locally higher amounts in squalls.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and hazardous marine conditions that can disrupt port operations and small-craft activity.
